001package org.consensusj.jsonrpc;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.net.HttpURLConnection;
005import java.net.URI;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.List;
008
009/**
010 *  JSON-RPC client interface. This interface is independent of the JSON conversion library
011 *  (the default implementation uses Jackson) and HTTP client library (currently {@link HttpURLConnection}).
012 *  For historical reasons the interface is synchronous, but {@link AsyncSupport} makes it easier
013 *  to add use of {@link java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture} for special cases. In the future
014 *  this interface may change to natively asynchronous.
015 *  <p>
016 *  Both JSON-RPC 1.0 and JSON-RPC 2.0 are supported. Implementations should also be (via configuration, perhaps)
017 *  lenient enough to support Bitcoin Core and similar servers that don't follow the JSON-RPC specifications exactly.
018 * @see <a href="https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification_v1">JSON-RPC 1.0 Specification (2005)</a>
019 * @see <a href="https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification">JSON-RPC 2.0 Specification</a>
020 */
021public interface JsonRpcClient extends AutoCloseable, AsyncSupport {
022
023    /**
024     * Return the JSON-RPC version used by the implementation
025     *
026     * @return JSON-RPC version
027     */
028    JsonRpcMessage.Version getJsonRpcVersion();
029
030    /**
031     * Get the URI of the remote server
032     * @return URI of remote server
033     */
034    URI getServerURI();
035    
036    /**
037     * Call an RPC method and return "default" object type. Caller should cast returned object to the correct type.
038     * <p>
039     * The parameter list is "untyped" (declared as {@code List<Object>}) and implementations are responsible
040     * for converting each Java object parameter to a valid and correctly-typed (for {@code method}) JSON object.
041     * <p>
042     * This is used to implement the {@code DynamicRpcMethodFallback} trait in Groovy which is applied
043     * to various Groovy RPC client implementations that typically inherit statically-dispatched
044     * methods from Java classes, but use {@code methodMissing()} to add JSON-RPC methods dynamically.
045     * This may be useful in other Dynamic JVM languages, as well.
046     *
047     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
048     * @param params JSON RPC parameters using types that are convertible to JSON
049     * @param <R> Type of result object
050     * @return the `response.result` field of the JSON-RPC response cast to type R
051     * @throws IOException network error
052     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
053     */
054    <R> R send(String method, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException;
055
056    /**
057     * Call an RPC method and return default object type.
058     *
059     * Convenience version that takes `params` as array/varargs.
060     *
061     * @param <R> Type of result object
062     * @param method JSON RPC method call to send
063     * @param params JSON RPC parameters as array or varargs
064     * @return the 'response.result' field of the JSON RPC response cast to type R
065     * @throws IOException network error
066     * @throws JsonRpcStatusException JSON RPC status error
067     */
068    default <R> R send(String method, Object... params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
069        return send(method, Arrays.asList(params));
070    }
071
072    <R> R send(String method, Class<R> resultType, List<Object> params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException;
073
074    default <R> R send(String method, Class<R> resultType, Object... params) throws IOException, JsonRpcStatusException {
075        return send(method, resultType, Arrays.asList(params));
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Create a JsonRpcRequest from method and parameters
080     *
081     * @param method name of method to call
082     * @param params parameter Java objects
083     * @return A ready-to-send JsonRpcRequest
084     */
085    default JsonRpcRequest buildJsonRequest(String method, List<Object> params) {
086        return new JsonRpcRequest(getJsonRpcVersion(), method, params);
087    }
088
089    default JsonRpcRequest buildJsonRequest(String method, Object... params) {
090        return new JsonRpcRequest(getJsonRpcVersion(), method, Arrays.asList(params));
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Default no-op implementation of close. Classes should override when
095     * they have something they need to close properly.
096     *
097     * @throws IOException if something happens during close
098     */
099    default void close() throws Exception {
100    }
101}
